a.aria-label: Semester Grades Middle School and High School Image

img.alt: Semester Grades Middle School and High School

a.span: Semester Grades Middle School and High School

p.span:
Thank you for your patience as we developed the following grading procedure. The state provided its guidance for grading yesterday, and the document you are receiving today reflects those directives.
The foundation of this process is based on our goal of minimizing the impact of the school closure on our students. The core of this grading procedure is to encourage students to stay engaged with the lessons and their learning activities. Through this engagement, teachers will provide feedback to students on their academic work to support the continued learning of academic standards.
As we work together to educate our students, please know we value your feedback. We appreciate your questions and are continually listening to your suggestions. We are committed to working in partnership to make adjustments for the benefit of all students.
Thank you for your support and keep safe.

a.title: Go to comments for Semester Grades Middle School and High School

a.aria-label: April 14, 2020 Message from Superintendent Kultgen Image

p.span: As we continue to march through the COVID-19 outbreak together, for every decision made many, many more appear. As a district, with each decision we are striving to minimize the negative impact of the closure on each student. This goal is difficult as the closure impacts every student, family and staff member and each one is impacted differently depending on their situation.

a.title: Go to comments for April 14, 2020 Message from Superintendent Kultgen

a.aria-label: April 6, 2020 Message from Superintendent Kultgen Image

p.span: Earlier today Governor Inslee extended the closing of all K-12 districts for the remainder of the school year. Snohomish students will continue their education through our distance learning plan. Last week a message was sent detailing the daily schedule of this plan. This will be the basis for student learning until the end of the year.

a.title: Go to comments for April 6, 2020 Message from Superintendent Kultgen

p.span: Previous signups have been reset for students who continue to need to check out a laptop. A new request form must be completed, even if a request was completed in previous weeks and the student did not pick up the laptop. Click here to complete a signup by 9 a.m. on Thursday, April 9.

a.title: Go to comments for Important - Computer/laptop requests

a.aria-label: Letter from the Superintendent - Secondary Instruction and Communication Image

img.alt: Letter from the Superintendent - Secondary Instruction and Communication

a.span: Letter from the Superintendent - Secondary Instruction and Communication

p.span: The purpose of this letter is to provide clarity around continued teacher communication and connections with students and families at the secondary level (middle school and high school) as well as regular cycles of daily and weekly instruction starting Monday, April 13. As our situation evolves we will continually assess, reflect, and adjust our practices to best meet the needs of our students, families, and staff.

a.title: Go to comments for Letter from the Superintendent - Secondary Instruction and Communication

a.aria-label: Letter from the Superintendent - Elementary Instruction and Communication Image

img.alt: Letter from the Superintendent - Elementary Instruction and Communication

a.span: Letter from the Superintendent - Elementary Instruction and Communication

p.span: The purpose of this letter is to provide clarity around continued teacher communication and connections with students and families at the elementary level as well as regular cycles of daily and weekly instruction starting Monday, April 13. As our situation evolves we will continually assess, reflect, and adjust our practices to best meet the needs of our students, families, and staff.

a.title: Go to comments for Letter from the Superintendent - Elementary Instruction and Communication

a.aria-label: Access to Learning for All Students Image

img.alt: Access to Learning for All Students

a.span: Access to Learning for All Students

p.span: I hope that you remain safe and healthy as we continue to grapple with the impact of this unprecedented viral outbreak as a community. Heading into the first week of April, I would like to share with you our plans for the next few days and weeks. There is much uncertainty during this time, and we are doing our best as a district to formulate and revise academic plans in response to this evolving health crisis. I am grateful for your flexibility, patience, and grace.

a.title: Go to comments for Access to Learning for All Students

a.aria-label: Message from State Superintendent Chris Reykdal During the COVID-19 Pandemic (March 27, 2020) Image

img.alt: Message from State Superintendent Chris Reykdal During the COVID-19 Pandemic (March 27, 2020)

a.span: Message from State Superintendent Chris Reykdal During the COVID-19 Pandemic (March 27, 2020)

p.span: Click to watch State Superintendent Chris Reykdal's March 27, 2020 message regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.title: Go to comments for Message from State Superintendent Chris Reykdal During the COVID-19 Pandemic (March 27, 2020)

p.span: Included is some important information we would like to share as we head into the weekend. As always, please stay safe.

a.title: Go to comments for March 27, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: Click today's update for more information about Kids' Cafe meal distribution, computers/laptops support and access to learning.

a.title: Go to comments for March 25, 2020 COVID-19 Update

a.aria-label: Family Video Message From Supt. Kultgen Image

img.alt: Family Video Message From Supt. Kultgen

a.span: Family Video Message From Supt. Kultgen

p.span: Please visit this link to view a family communication video from Superintendent Kultgen.

a.title: Go to comments for Family Video Message From Supt. Kultgen

p.span: You will have the opportunity to check out these devices at the following locations and times. Students are able to check out computers/laptops. However, a parent/guardian will need to accompany students who requested hotspots. Please have your ID or your students school ID available. While picking up your devices, please practice social distancing and be patient as we distribute devices. Laptop user agreements will be at the sites of students and families to sign before devices will be distributed.

a.title: Go to comments for March 24 Device Distribution Update

p.span: A number of students and families have reached out to us regarding their windows for device distribution. Included are larger time frame distribution opportunities for pick- up. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused. Feel free to come at any of the available times, but please note there may be longer than expected wait times.

a.title: Go to comments for Device Distribution

p.span: Thank you for your patience and understanding during these ever evolving times. Included is more information as we enter our second week.

a.title: Go to comments for March 23, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: Click for updates to access to learning, graduation, Kids' cafe and student computers/laptops.

a.title: Go to comments for March 20, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: Beginning Monday, March 23, Kids' Cafe meals will be delivered using district buses/vehicles along bus routes. Please follow this link to get route and meal drop-off information.

a.title: Go to comments for March 19, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: With the district-wide closure of all schools in the Snohomish School District, we wanted to provide families with more information to support students access to learning. The materials do not replace the experience of being in school but can help students maintain the learning that has taken place this school year.

a.title: Go to comments for March 18, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: Thank you for your partnership and understanding as we navigate the COVID-19 situation together. Today's communication contains information you may find useful this week.

a.title: Go to comments for March 16, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: As each of us moves into the weekend, I want to recommend you take this time to relax, take lots of deep breaths and spend time with your friends and family. It is critical that each of us takes care of ourselves and each other during this unprecedented time.

a.title: Go to comments for March 13, 2020 COVID-19 Update

p.span: As you are likely aware, Governor Jay Inslee just ordered a proclamation closing all K-12 school districts (public and private) in Snohomish, King and Pierce Counties through Friday, April 24. If the closure order does not get extended, students would return to class on Monday, April 27. This announcement aligns with our districts closure decision.

a.title: Go to comments for March 12, 2020 COVID-10 Update

a.aria-label: March 11, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families Image

img.alt: March 11, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families

a.span: March 11, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families

p.span: Beginning Friday, March 13, all Snohomish School District schools will be closed through April 24 (at that time conditions will be reevaluated and adjusted if necessary). Tomorrow, Thursday, March 12, will be a regular school day. This will allow for an additional day of learning and time for students to bring home any personal items they might want while schools are closed.

a.title: Go to comments for March 11, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families

a.aria-label: March 10, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families Image

img.alt: March 10, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families

a.span: March 10, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families

p.span:
All of our schools were closed on Tuesday, March 10, after learning a district-level employee who works in our Transportation Department office tested positive for COVID-19 on Monday, March 9. The impacted employee has been quarantined and is being cared for and monitored as recommended by the Washington State Department of Health/Snohomish Health District.
As a point of clarification, this employee works in an office and does not have contact with any students. In addition, the Washington State Department of Health/Snohomish Health District completed its investigation and has determined that no other individuals in the Snohomish School District were identified as close contacts and there was no need for any student or staff member to be in quarantine.
Student transportation, school and classes across our district will resume on Wednesday, March 11.

a.title: Go to comments for March 10, 2020 COVID-10 Update and Information For Families

a.aria-label: March 9, 2020 Update - Schools Closed March 10 Image

p.span: On March 9, 2020, the Snohomish Health District confirmed that a district-level employee who works in our Transportation Department office tested positive for COVID-19. As we have shared in previous communications regarding potential building closures, we stated if there was a confirmed case we would close the facility to allow for cleaning and for the Washington State Department of Health/Snohomish Health District to determine possible close contacts. As a result, we will be closing our transportation facility.This closure will impact our ability to transport students, and as a result all Snohomish School District schools will be closed for Tuesday, March 10, 2020. All school, athletic and other activities across the district have been canceled on Tuesday, March 10.

a.title: Go to comments for March 9, 2020 Update - Schools Closed March 10

p.span: March 9, 2020 - With the evolving COVID-19 situation, all middle school athletic competitions have been canceled through Spring Break (April 6). After-school practices will continue as planned. We will continue to keep our families updated in the event the situation changes.

a.title: Go to comments for Middle school athletics

p.span: As the Snohomish School District Emergency Response Team (ERT) meets and follows the Snohomish Health Districts guidance, we are enacting several new safety measures in response to the COVID-19 outbreak. These measures are necessary in order for the district to continue its educational mission, keep schools open, and meet its obligations to the wider community. We recognize these new precautions will likely create hardships in our community. However, these measures, under the guidance of the Snohomish Health District, are being put into place to reduce exposure to COVID-19 by limiting the number of people coming in and out of our buildings, conserve on vital resources (custodial supplies and labor) and align with neighboring districts whom we are working closely.

a.title: Go to comments for March 6, 2020 Update and FAQs

div.p: Snohomish School District 1601 Avenue D Snohomish, WA 98290 Site Map
Snohomish School District 1601 Avenue D Snohomish, WA 98290 Site Map
Snohomish School District 1601 Avenue D Snohomish, WA 98290

div.div: The Snohomish School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights Coordinator, Title IX Coordinator and ADA Darryl Pernat, 1601 Avenue D, Snohomish, WA 98290, 360-563-7285, darryl.pernat@sno.wednet.edu; Section 504 Coordinator and Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying Shawn Stevenson, 1601 Avenue D, Snohomish, WA 98290, 360-563-7314, shawn.stevenson@sno.wednet.edu.
